Package Collecto

Class TUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • Collecto.TUI
  • public class TUI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the Textual User Interface used by all other classes in the Collecto program to print anything on the screen of a user. It contains methods to return logs with dates and time added to them, print strings, print errors, print a board, print a help menu and return a string with coloured balls. It is used by many classes, mainly the Game, Client, Server and PlayerHandler classes.
    See Also:
    Game, Client, Server, PlayerHandler

      • textBoard

        public static java.lang.String textBoard​(GridBoard gridBoard)
        Returns a coloured string representation of a provided board. Returned representation has line numeration starting from 1, and ANSI coloured balls names.

        This method should not be called directly, instead use colouredBoard(GridBoard).

        Parameters:
        gridBoard - GridBoard to be represented as a string
        Returns:
        coloured string representation of the provided board
        See Also:
        Ball

      • colouredBoard

        public static java.lang.String colouredBoard​(GridBoard gridBoard)
        Returns coloured representation of the GridBoard provided. Returned representation has line numeration starting from 1 and ANSI coloured balls names.
        Parameters:
        gridBoard - GridBoard to represent as a string
        Returns:
        coloured string representation of the given GridBoard

      • boardString

        static java.lang.String boardString​(GridBoard gridBoard)
        Returns a basic text representation of the provided GridBoard. Returned representation does not have line numeration and colourisation.
        Parameters:
        gridBoard - board to make a representation of
        Returns:
        text representation of provided GridBoard as a String

      • printHelpClient

        public static void printHelpClient()
        Prints a help menu belonging to a client. Help contains all commands that a client can directly use and their descriptions.

      • ballColours

        public static java.lang.String ballColours​(java.util.ArrayList<Ball> balls)
        Converts provided array of balls to a string, where every ball in the array is represented as a special symbol (●) with a set colour of this ball. Used to show the balls of a player.
        Parameters:
        balls - array of balls to be represented as a string
        Returns:
        string with balls in provided array represented as coloured symbols
